title: Paul Ince disagrees with Dimitar Berbatov over Man Utd target Mario Mandzukic
text:
Manchester United are confident of signing Juventus misfit Mario Mandzukic (Picture: Getty)

Paul Ince has urged Manchester United to call off their pursuit of Mario Mandzukic as the Juventus forward is not the answer to Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s problems up front.

The Red Devils have identified Mandzukic as their number one attacking target ahead of the January transfer window and the club are confident of landing the 33-year-old for a fee of around £9million.

Mandzukic has been frozen out at Juventus by new manager Maurizio Sarri and the Serie A champions are looking to cash in on the veteran striker.

The World Cup runner-up is yet to play a single competitive match this season since Sarri took over the reins from Massimiliano Allegri in Turin.

United are ready to offer the Croatian an 18-month contract and £4.4m-a-year wages in order to get a deal over the line in the new year.

Ince does not believe Mandzukic is the answer to United’s problems in attack (Picture: Getty)

Though United are desperate for attacking reinforcements after a miserable start to the campaign, Ince hopes his former club don’t resort to signing ‘stop-gaps’ like Mandzukic.

‘I don’t think Mandzukic is the answer,’ Ince told The Daily Mirror.

‘I feel that you never get your best players in January, clubs don’t sell their best players in January, so whoever Manchester United are going to get is going to be a stop-gap.

‘If they’re looking to go down the young route then the should be looking at young strikers, not Zlatan [Ibrahimovic] or Mandzukic.’

Mandzukic is yet to play for Juve this term (Picture: Getty)

Ince added: ‘United parted company with both Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez in the summer, with Solskjaer opting against signing replacements.

‘Against AZ Alkmaar they didn’t have a shot on target – that’s embarrassing.

‘Three pathetic shots against Newcastle, that’s embarrassing as well for Man United.’

Berbatov has backed United’s move for Mandzukic (Picture: Getty)

Dimitar Berbatov disagrees with Ince over United’s bid for Mandzukic and believes the Croatia international could have a similar impact to Zlatan Ibrahimovic at Old Trafford.

‘They have the talent in the young players but at the same time you need someone like Mandzukic,’ the ex-United star told Betfair.

‘I think he is a really good football player and he hasn’t played before in England, but I hope if he comes he can straight away get into the rhythm of the Premier League.

‘Zlatan Ibrahimovic was 34 years old when he signed for United and he didn’t have any problems.

‘Mandzukic is a similar age and hope he could have the same impact if he signs.

‘I think his age is a good thing, [Anthony] Martial, Rashford and [Mason] Greenwood are all young players so they need that time and assurance that they don’t need to worry and they can learn from the experience of Mandzukic.’

Berbatov added: ‘The winter transfer window is going to be difficult and on the pitch Manchester United aren’t producing as a team at the moment.

‘It doesn’t matter how good you are, Lionel Messi or Cristiano Ronaldo could go there and they would have difficulty because the team is not producing.’
